_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0 Executive Summary

1.1. The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at the Rinchem Company Inc., Hollister, CA Hazardous Material Storage Warehouse (CSC 15). 

Rinchem Company, Inc. (CSC 15) is committed to being a responsible member of the community in which it operates by giving top priority to operating in a safe and environmentally sound manner. Policy dictates that

Rinchem personnel continuously identify methods to reduce the risk of handling hazardous materials and to reduce the risk to the community and environment through the implementation of new technology and procedures. This commitment to safe and environmentally sound operations is documented in the Team Member Handbook, and the mission statement, which are available to all employees. The Safety and Health policy states:

"SAFETY FIRST is more than a slogan at Rinchem...it is a way of life." Rinchem Company, Inc. is committed to provide a safe working environment for its staff members, its customers and the public, and maintains that

"NO JOB IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF OUR STAFF MEMBERS, OUR COMMUNITIES, AND THE ENVIRONMENT." We recognize that the responsibilities for safety and health are shared among:

Management, in particular the Director of Quality, ES&H, accepts the responsibility for leadership of the safety and health program, for its effectiveness and improvement, and for providing the safeguards required to ensure safe conditions. 

Managers and supervisors are responsible for ensuring processes are documented to reinforce safety as well as the use of engineering controls as the preferred method of promoting safety and eliminating unsafe conditions. 

Employees are responsible for cooperation with all aspects of the safety and health program including compliance with all rules, documented procedures, and regulations and for continuously practicing safety while performing their duties. They are also responsible for stopping activities that may lea

d to injuries to themselves or others. Staff members, being the most familiar with actual operations, are responsible to document suggestions for continuous improvements. Each employee is granted the authority to stop work if it is deemed unsafe. The job will not be continued until the work methods are evaluated and changed, if necessary, to make the work area safe.

Management continues to do all it can to protect the Health and Safety of all employees and to provide a safe working environment. However, safety requires the participation of everyone...only you can make safety a reality. Be alert for conditions which appear unsafe and report unsafe conditions immediately. Employees are encouraged to report any accident, "near miss", exposure, incident, spill or release.

1.2. A Description of the Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehousing a RMP EHS(regulated substance)

1.2.1. Description of the Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehousing Hazardous Materials I their original UN/DOT Packaging

The Hollister, CA (CSC 15)Warehouse is located at 2301 Bert Drive, Hollister, CA, 95023. The facility provides transportation and public warehousing services for manufacturers, distributors and end users of UN/DOT prepackaged specialty chemicals. Warehousing activities include shipping, receiving and storage of chemicals as specified by customer requirements. The chemicals stored at the Hollister, CA (CSC 15) warehouse include chemicals containing toxic hazards. The only RMP EHS(regulated substance) at the warehouse is Hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater). 

1.2.2. Description of the Warehousing Process

Rinchem receives its listed EHS (regulated substance) by truck as shipped from the manufacturer or distributor. The material is unloaded from the truck using a forklift and staged for inspection. After the material passes quality and safety inspection, it is placed into the hazard specific storage area until it is shipped to the end user. The storage location of each material is tracked in an

electronic inventory management system. After an order is received, Rinchem ships the above listed chemical as ordered by the end user. The material is picked and staged for quality and safety inspection. After the material passes inspection, it is loaded on to a truck for shipment using a powered industrial truck (PIT).

1.3. Worst-Case Release Scenario

-    N/A

1.4. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Reference Intelex Document Number 1502 Environmental, Safety, Health Reporting and CSC 15 Business Continuity and Emergency Action Plan (CSC 15-BC and EA Plan)

1.5. The Five Year Accident History there has never been a reportable accident involving a EHS(regulated substance) Hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater) at the Hollister, CA Warehouse.

1.6. The Emergency Action Plan

Overall safety at the Rinchem Company, Inc. Hollister, CA (CSC 15) warehouse is governed not only by our ability to prevent accidental releases of Hydrochloric acid (conc. 37% or greater)  from occurring, but also by the ability to mitigate any accidental releases of the above mentioned material. Rinchem has developed an emergency action plan to minimize the effects of accidental releases of regulated substances to employees. Rinchem management has opted to respond to releases of these chemical(s) by containing the spill when it can be safely done and using contracted services for spill cleanup.

The CSC 15 Emergency Action Plan procedures consists of the following documents:

-    Intelex Document Number 1502 Environmental, Safety, Health Reporting

-    Intelex Document Number CSC 15 Business Continuity and Emergency Action Plan (CSC 15-BC and EA Plan)

-    CERS CONSOLIDATED EMERGENCY RESPONSE / CONTINGENCY PLAN
